How to Install arachne-pnr on debian

  • Home
  • debian
  • arachne-pnr

Today in this tutorial, I’ll show you how you can install arachne-pnr on debian with and without using the command line.

Introduction

Installing arachne-pnr on debian is very easy. And with the help of this tutorial, you will be able to easily install, update and uninstall arachne-pnr in just a few steps.

In this tutorial I’ll show you four methods to install arachne-pnr, the methods are using apt, apt-get, aptitude, and synaptic. All these methods require you to have an active and stable internet connection and sudo permission.

Install arachne-pnr Using apt

To install arachne-pnr in debian using apt, you will need to run the apt update command first to get the updated list of packages from the repositories.

Copy the command given below and paste it in the command line, then press enter. If you are using the sudo command for the first time then you might also need to enter your root password.

sudo apt update

After you have updated the package list using apt, you can now install arachne-pnr using the apt install command. To do that use the command given below.

sudo apt -y install arachne-pnr

The installation of arachne-pnr might take a little bit of time depending upon your internet connection and machine configuration.

Install arachne-pnr Using apt-get

To install arachne-pnr using apt-get in debian, you will need to first update the package list using the apt-get update command. Copy, paste, and enter the command given below in the command line.

sudo apt-get update

After updating the package lists, use the apt-get install command given below to install arachne-pnr.

sudo apt-get -y install arachne-pnr

Install arachne-pnr Using Synaptic

To install arachne-pnr using Synaptic you will need to first install Synaptic, you can do that by following the instructions from here. After installing synaptic follow the steps below to install arachne-pnr on your debian using Synaptic.

You can open synaptic by clicking on the menu icon then searching for synaptic or you can open the command line and enter the command given below –

sudo synaptic

After synaptic opens, click on the search icon and search for arachne-pnr. This will display the arachne-pnr package in the package window, now to install arachne-pnr, click on the checkbox that is on the left side.

Then click on Mark for Installation, this will select the arachne-pnr package for installation, now to install it click on the Apply button, you will get a summary window where click on the apply button again to start the download of arachne-pnr.

If the download and installation are successful then the checkmark option will turn green.

Install arachne-pnr Using aptitude

To install arachne-pnr on debian using aptitude, you will need to first install Aptitude in your debian. To install Aptitude follow the instructions here. Once you have aptitude installed proceed to the installation of arachne-pnr.

Now you will need to first update your package lists from the repositories, use the apt update command for that, after that update the package list of aptitude using the aptitude update command.

sudo apt update sudo aptitude update

After updating the package list of aptitude, install arachne-pnr using the command aptitude install arachne-pnr.

sudo aptitude -y install arachne-pnr

How to Upgrade arachne-pnr on debian

If you want to upgrade the arachne-pnr package on your debian to its latest version then here’s how you can do that using apt, apt-get, aptitude, and synaptic.

Upgrade arachne-pnr using Apt & Apt-get

To upgrade arachne-pnr to its latest version using apt or apt-get, you will need to open the terminal then run the sudo apt update command to update the package list, after that copy and paste the commands given below to upgrade arachne-pnr.

sudo apt install --only-upgrade arachne-pnr sudo apt-get install --only-upgrade arachne-pnr

Upgrade arachne-pnr using Aptitude

To upgrade arachne-pnr using aptitude you will need to again run the update command to update the package list, use command sudo aptitude update to do that. After that run the command given below to upgrade arachne-pnr.

sudo aptitude -y full-upgrade arachne-pnr

Upgrade arachne-pnr using Synaptic

To upgrade arachne-pnr using synaptic open synaptic using the command sudo synaptic or by going to the menu and searching for synaptic.

In synaptic click on the reload button, this will look for updates. After that you will need to search for arachne-pnr, now right-click arachne-pnr, and click on the mark for upgrade option.

Now to upgrade arachne-pnr just click on the apply button, then click on the apply button again in the summary screen.

How To Uninstall arachne-pnr on debian

If you want to remove and uninstall arachne-pnr from your debian then here’s how you can do that. To remove just arachne-pnr, you can use the command that is given below, copy the command, paste it in the command line then press enter.

sudo apt remove arachne-pnr

Remove related packages, dependencies & configuration files of arachne-pnr

To remove all the related packages, dependencies and configuration files of arachne-pnr you can use the command given below.

sudo apt -y purge arachne-pnr

Remove arachne-pnr using Synaptic Package Manager

You can also uninstall arachne-pnr using the synaptic package manager, first open synaptic using the command sudo synaptic or search and open it directly.

After that in synaptic search for arachne-pnr, right-click the arachne-pnr package and click on the Mark for Complete Removal option. Now to uninstall arachne-pnr click on the apply button then in summary click on apply again.

Conclusion

That is how you can install arachne-pnr on debian using the command line or using the synaptic package manager. I also showed you how you can uninstall and upgrade arachne-pnr using the command line or using the synaptic package manager.

If you need any help regarding the installation of arachne-pnr then send me a mail at netmikoblog@gmail.com, thank you.
